parameters.description:
If enabled, an inbox result matching an existing thing is automatically ignored.

If set to false, the inbox may contain results although identical things already exist.
parameters.label: Auto Ignore
parameters.name: autoIgnore

parameters.description: If enabled, inbox results are automatically approved, unless they were marked as ignored.
parameters.label: Auto Approve
parameters.name: autoApprove

parameters.description: Defines the UI theme.
parameters.label: Theme
parameters.name: theme

parameters.description: Defines whether bitmap or vector icons are used by the UI.
parameters.label: Icon Format
parameters.name: iconType

parameters.description: Defines whether UI renders icons for the widgets or not.
parameters.label: Enable Icons
parameters.name: enableIcons

parameters.description: When enabled, changes the layout so that more widgets can fit on the screen.
parameters.label: Condensed Layout
parameters.name: condensedLayout

parameters.description: Displays all widget states in uppercase.
parameters.label: Capitalize Values
parameters.name: capitalizeValues

parameters.description: The sitemap to show if no parameter is passed.
parameters.label: Default Sitemap
parameters.name: defaultSitemap

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the thing will be state-less then.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Any supported transformation can be used. An example for a received JSON from a MQTT state topic would be a pattern of JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like ON) that is recognised as on state.
parameters.label: ON value
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: A number (like 0, -10) or a string (like OFF) that is recognised as off state.
parameters.label: OFF value
parameters.name: off

parameters.description: Inverse the meaning. A received "ON" will switch the thing channel off and vice versa.
parameters.label: Inverse
parameters.name: inverse

parameters.description: A broadcast address (e.g. 192.168.1.255)
parameters.label: Broadcast Address
parameters.name: broadcastAddress

parameters.description: Use only one IP address per interface and family
parameters.label: Single IP Address per Interface
parameters.name: useOnlyOneAddress

parameters.description: Use IPv6 Addresses if available
parameters.label: Use IPv6
parameters.name: useIPv6

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the thing will be state-less then.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. This can be left empty
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Any supported transformation can be used. An example for a received JSON from a MQTT state topic would be a pattern of JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Minimum value to convert the MQTT state to a percentage
parameters.label: Minimum value
parameters.name: min

parameters.description: Maximum value to convert the MQTT state to a percentage
parameters.label: Maximum value
parameters.name: max

parameters.description: The step value is used if the value channel is bound to a Dimmer item and an increase/decrease is issued
parameters.label: Step value
parameters.name: step

parameters.description: Set to true if the MQTT topic expects a float/double decimal instead of an integer value
parameters.label: Is Decimal?
parameters.name: isfloat

parameters.description: The default text-to-speech service to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Text-to-Speech
parameters.name: defaultTTS

parameters.description: The default speech-to-text service to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Speech-to-Text
parameters.name: defaultSTT

parameters.description: The default voice to use if no specific TTS service or voice is specified.
parameters.label: Default Voice
parameters.name: defaultVoice

parameters.description: The default human language interpreter to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Human Language Interpreter
parameters.name: defaultHLI

parameters.description: The default keyword spotting service to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Keyword Spotter
parameters.name: defaultKS

parameters.description: The magic word to spot before initiating a dialog.
parameters.label: Magic Word
parameters.name: keyword

parameters.description: If provided, the item will be switched on during the period when the dialog processor has spotted the keyword and is listening for commands.
parameters.label: Listening switch
parameters.name: listeningItem

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the thing will be state-less then.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Any supported transformation can be used. An example for a received JSON from a MQTT state topic would be a pattern of JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: List all valid states. Separate multiple states with commas. An example for a light bulb state set: ON,DIMMED,OFF
parameters.label: Allowed states
parameters.name: allowedStates

parameters.description: The default audio source to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Source
parameters.name: defaultSource

parameters.description: The default audio sink to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Sink
parameters.name: defaultSink

parameters.description: Auto Update
parameters.name: value

parameters.description: Sets the number of backup files to keep.
parameters.label: Backup files
parameters.name: backup_files

parameters.description: Sets the time to wait before writing changes to disk. This can reduce the number of writes when many changes are being introduced within a short period. Time is defined in milliseconds.
parameters.label: Write delay
parameters.name: write_delay

parameters.description: Sets the maximum period the service will wait to write data to disk in the event that many changes are happening continually.
parameters.label: Maximum write delay
parameters.name: max_defer_delay

parameters.description: JSON object containing the registry of panel configurations. Normally only modified with the embedded designer, edit by hand at your own risk!
parameters.label: Panel registry JSON
parameters.name: panelsRegistry

parameters.description: Edit mode is unavailable in the UI when enabled. Keeping the configuration locked and unlocking only when needed helps prevent accidental changes.
parameters.label: Lock editing
parameters.name: lockEditing

parameters.description: The name of the existing panel configuration to switch to initially when accessing HABPanel with no prior local configuration.
parameters.label: Initial panel configuration
parameters.name: initialPanelConfig

parameters.description: Defines whether openHAB should access the remote repository for add-on installation.
parameters.label: Access Remote Repository
parameters.name: remote

parameters.description: Also allows the installation of 1.x bindings for which there is already a 2.x version available (requires remote repo access!).
parameters.label: Include Legacy 1.x Bindings
parameters.name: legacy

parameters.description: Offset (plain number or number with unit) to be applied on the state towards the item. The negative offset will be applied in the reverse direction.
parameters.label: Offset
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Pairing must be enabled to connect a new device. Once a device has been added, pairing should be disabled.
parameters.label: Enable Device Pairing
parameters.name: pairingEnabled

parameters.description: If your host has multiple IP addresses you may specify the IP you would like to advertise in the UPNP discovery process. You may safely leave this empty on most systems.
parameters.label: Optional discovery address
parameters.name: discoveryIp

parameters.description: Some Hue applications require a different port (80) then what openHAB runs on by default (8080).  This option will only advertise a different port then what we are listening on.  Useful if you have an iptables rule redirect traffic from this port to the openHAB port.
parameters.label: Optional discovery web port
parameters.name: discoveryHttpPort

parameters.description: A custom broker connection port. Leave empty to use the default MQTT ports 1883 and 8883 (SSL) for secure or non-secure connections.
parameters.label: Embedded broker port
parameters.name: port

parameters.description: If set, hosts a secure SSL connection on port 8883 or otherwise a non secure connection on port 1883 (if not overwritten by the port parameter)
parameters.label: Secure connection?
parameters.name: secure

parameters.description: Connections need to provide this username to access the broker.
parameters.label: Embedded broker username
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Connections need to provide this password to access the broker. Should only be used if it is a secure connection, because the password is transferred plain over the wire.
parameters.label: Embedded broker password
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: An optional persistence file. Retained messages are stored in this file. Can be empty to not store anything. If it starts with "/" on Linux/MacOS or with a drive letter and colon (eg "c:/") it will be treated as an absolute path. Be careful to select a path that you have write access to.
parameters.label: Persistence file
parameters.name: persistenceFile

parameters.description: The IP/Hostname of the MQTT broker
parameters.label: Broker Hostname/IP
parameters.name: host

parameters.description: The port is optional, if none is provided, the typical ports 1883 and 8883 (SSL) are used.
parameters.label: Broker Port
parameters.name: port

parameters.description: Uses TLS/SSL to establish a secure connection to the broker. Can be "OFF","ON","AUTO". The AUTO setting prefers a secure connection but will fall-back to an insecure one. Default is ON.
parameters.label: Secure connection
parameters.name: secure

parameters.description: Use a fixed client ID. Defaults to empty which means a user ID is generated for this connection.
parameters.label: Client ID
parameters.name: clientid

parameters.description: Retained messages are stored on the MQTT broker and other clients can retrieve the value at any time
parameters.label: Retain messages
parameters.name: retain

parameters.description: Reconnect time in ms. If a connection is lost, the binding will wait this time before it tries to reconnect.
parameters.label: Reconnect time
parameters.name: reconnect_time

parameters.description: Keep alive / heartbeat timer in ms. It can take up to this time to determine if a server connection is lost. A lower value may keep the broker unnecessarily busy for no or little additional value.
parameters.label: Heartbeat
parameters.name: keep_alive_time

parameters.description: The last will message.
parameters.label: Last will message
parameters.name: lastwill_message

parameters.description: Defaults to empty and therefore disables the last will.
parameters.label: Last will topic
parameters.name: lastwill_topic

parameters.description: The quality of service parameter of the last will.
parameters.label: Last will QoS
parameters.name: lastwill_qos

parameters.description: The MQTT username
parameters.label: Username
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The MQTT password
parameters.label: Password
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: If this and SSL is set: After the next connection has been successfully established, the certificate is pinned. The connection will be refused if another certificate is used. Clear **certificate** to allow a new certificate for the next connection attempt. This option can increase security.
parameters.label: Certificate pinning
parameters.name: certificatepin

parameters.description: If **certificatepin** is set this hash is used to verify the connection. Clear to allow a new certificate pinning on the next connection attempt. If empty will be filled automatically by the next successful connection. An example input would be `SHA-256:83F9171E06A313118889F7D79302BD1B7A2042EE0CFD029ABF8DD06FFA6CD9D3`.
parameters.label: Certificate hash
parameters.name: certificate

parameters.description: If this and SSL is set: After the next connection has been successfully established, the public key of the broker is pinned. The connection will be refused if another public key is used. Clear **publickey** to allow a new public key for the next connection attempt. This option can increase security.
parameters.label: Public key pinning
parameters.name: publickeypin

parameters.description: If **publickeypin** is set this hash is used to verify the connection. Clear to allow a new public key pinning on the next connection attempt. If empty will be filled automatically by the next successful connection. An example input would be `SHA-256:83F9171E06A313118889F7D79302BD1B7A2042EE0CFD029ABF8DD06FFA6CD9D3`
parameters.label: Public Key Hash
parameters.name: publickey

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the thing will be state-less then.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. This can be left empty
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Any supported transformation can be used. An example for a received JSON from a MQTT state topic would be a pattern of JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: The channel will send updates as RGB values and expects RGB values from the state topic.
parameters.label: RGB instead of HSV
parameters.name: rgb

parameters.description:
The default language that should be used. If not specified, the system default locale is used.

The ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code (if there is no alpha-2 one).

Example: "en" (English), "de" (German), "ja" (Japanese), "kok" (Konkani)
parameters.label: Language
parameters.name: language

parameters.description:
The script that should be used.

ISO 15924 alpha-4 script code.

Example: "Latn" (Latin), "Cyrl" (Cyrillic)
parameters.label: Script
parameters.name: script

parameters.description:
The region that should be used.

ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code.

Example: "US" (United States), "DE" (Germany), "FR" (France), "029" (Caribbean)
parameters.label: Country / Region
parameters.name: region

parameters.description:
A variation of the locale.

Any arbitrary value used to indicate a variation of a Locale.

Example: "polyton" (Polytonic Greek), "POSIX"
parameters.label: Variant
parameters.name: variant

parameters.description:
A time zone can be set from the user interface.

The underlying system's time zone is the default.

Example: Asia/Tokyo, Europe/Berlin
parameters.label: Time Zone
parameters.name: timezone

parameters.description:
The location of this installation.

Coordinates as <latitude>,<longitude>[<altitude>]

Example: "52.5200066,13.4049540" (Berlin)
parameters.label: Location
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: The measurement system is used for unit conversion.
parameters.label: Measurement System
parameters.name: measurementSystem

parameters.description: The period between successive firmware status info job execution.
parameters.label: Period
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: The time to delay the first firmware status info job execution.
parameters.label: Delay
parameters.name: delay

parameters.description: The time unit of the firmware status info job execution.
parameters.label: Time unit
parameters.name: timeUnit

parameters.description: Defines the default height in pixels for the chart to build.
parameters.label: Default Height
parameters.name: defaultHeight

parameters.description: Defines the default width in pixels for the chart to build.
parameters.label: Default Width
parameters.name: defaultWidth

parameters.description: Defines the scale to apply to the requested chart height (0.5 to divide by 2 for example).
parameters.label: Scale
parameters.name: scale

parameters.description: Defines the maximum width in pixels for the chart to build.
parameters.label: Maximum Width
parameters.name: maxWidth

parameters.description: The persistence service to use if no other is specified.
parameters.label: Default Service
parameters.name: default

parameters.description:
In simple mode, links and their according items are automatically created for new Things.

If the simple mode is turned off, the user has the full control about which items channels are linked to. Existing links will remain untouched.
parameters.label: Simple Mode
parameters.name: autoLinks

parameters.label: Node ID

parameters.description: HomeAssistant Device ID
parameters.label: Device ID
parameters.name: deviceid

parameters.label: MQTT base prefix

parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.label: Step value

parameters.label: Is Decimal?

parameters.description: The string item to pass voice commands to.
parameters.label: Voice Command Item
parameters.name: item

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the thing will be state-less then.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. This can be left empty

parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Any supported transformation can be used. An example for a received JSON from a MQTT state topic would be a pattern of JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: If your MQTT topic is limited to a set of one or more specific commands or specific states, define those states here. Separate multiple states with commas. An example for a light bulb state set: ON,DIMMED,OFF
parameters.label: Allowed states
parameters.name: allowedStates

parameters.description: The port the language server listens to
parameters.label: Port
parameters.name: port

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: Any supported transformation can be used. An example for a received JSON from a MQTT state topic would be a pattern of JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
parameters.label: Transformation pattern
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like "open") that is recognised as on state.
parameters.label: Open value
parameters.name: open

parameters.description: A number (like 0, -10) or a string (like "close") that is recognised as off state.
parameters.label: Close value
